etymology.description: 妹(妹) (mèi, "younger sister") + 妹(妹) (mèi, "younger sister") = repetition for emphasis or endearment, referring collectively to younger sisters or a young girl
etymology.interpretation: 妹妹 (mèimei) combines 妹(妹) (mèi, "younger sister") twice to emphasize the idea of a younger female sibling, often used affectionately. The repetition not only reinforces the familial relationship but can also imply endearment or a familial role, similar to saying 'little sister' or affectionately addressing a young girl.

examples.chinese: 我的妹妹很可爱(我的妹妹很可愛)。
examples.english: My younger sister is very cute.

examples.chinese: 我陪妹妹玩耍(我陪妹妹玩耍)，她笑得很开心(她笑得很開心)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ péi mèimei wánshuǎ, tā xiào de hěn kāixīn.
examples.english: I play with my younger sister, and she laughs happily.

examples.chinese: 妹妹在花园里采花(妹妹在花園裡採花)。
examples.english: My younger sister picks flowers in the garden.
